question: Which country drafted the resolution, which was adopted by the UN General Assembly, on equitable access to essential medical supplies?
explanation:
The UN General Assembly resolution adopted a resolution, drafted by Mexico, on fair, transparent and equitable access to essential medical supplies and any future vaccines developed to fight COVID-19.
India along with another 174 countries co-sponsored the resolution, among the 193 members of the assembly. The resolution was titled 'International cooperation to ensure global access to medicines, vaccines and medical equipment to face COVID-19'.
